headers: TUP STATE MACHINE — FORMAL PROTOCOL SPECIFICATION

rows.TUP STATE MACHINE — FORMAL PROTOCOL SPEC: The TUP Lifecycle expressed as a formal state machine. States, transitions, conditions, permissions.
This tab formalizes what TUP Lifecycle Phases describes in prose. Same system, machine-readable description.
Lives at DAO headquarters inside the IonWave Trade. The protocol layer IS the Trade.

rows.col_5: Artifacts Required

rows.col_3: TUP does not exist. Not yet committed by thesis.
rows.col_5: None

rows.col_3: TUP committed to existence. P-tab created. Scope defined. Skeleton tabs built. Not yet in production.
rows.col_5: P-tab with: scope, win conditions, tab list, dependencies, cluster assignment

rows.col_3: TUP is being authored. AI production loop active. Content tabs being filled.
rows.col_5: All content tabs (C-tabs) with first-draft content. Librarian confirms completeness against P-tab.

rows.col_3: Draft complete. Librarian checking structural completeness. Conductor checking sequencing.
rows.col_5: Librarian sign-off on structural completeness. No broken cross-references. Conductor confirms not blocking.

rows.col_3: Domain expert grading. ACP criteria applied. Grade recorded.
rows.col_5: Expert grade recorded on V-tab. ACP criteria evaluated. Grade + review notes filed.
rows.col_6: S5 (LOCKED) if grade≥B, S2 (PRODUCTION) if grade≤C

rows.col_3: Imagination frozen. Content tabs read-only. Grade is final. TUP is reference material.
rows.col_5: Lock confirmation by Librarian. Version number assigned. All tabs set read-only.
rows.col_6: S6 (IMPLEMENTATION), S4 (EXPERT_REVIEW) via formal amendment only

rows.col_3: Tasks extracted for real-world execution. Implementation passet (File 2) receives task extraction.
rows.col_5: Implementation TUP in File 2 with: tasks, owners, deadlines, dependencies.

rows.col_3: Execution complete or killed. Lessons captured. Template updates proposed.
rows.col_5: Post-mortem doc. Template update proposals. Lessons filed.
Guard Conditions

rows.col_4: M0 thesis commits TUP to existence
rows.col_5: M0 must be in state LOCKED (S5) or DRAFT (S1) for first-wave TUPs
rows.col_7: P-tab created. Skeleton tabs generated. Cluster assignment recorded.

rows.col_5: P-tab complete. Cluster activated by Conductor. PM has tool access.
rows.col_7: PM receives extracted tab slice via Google Drive. Claude session initialized.

rows.col_5: All C-tabs have content. PM self-check against P-tab spec.
rows.col_7: Librarian QA begins. Conductor checks cluster sequencing.

rows.col_5: Zero broken cross-references. All dependencies consistent. Terms indexed.
rows.col_7: Expert Reviewer receives TUP package. Review clock starts.

rows.col_5: Grade recorded on V-tab. ACP criteria all PASS or PASS_WITH_NOTES.
rows.col_7: Tabs set read-only. Version assigned. Equity vests for PM. Grade is final.

rows.col_5: Specific remediation items listed. Not a full restart.
rows.col_7: PM receives remediation list. Re-enters production for specific fixes.

rows.col_5: Specific remediation items listed by expert. One revision cycle allowed.
rows.col_7: PM receives expert remediation. If still ≤C after revision: escalate to Nilo.

rows.col_5: Entity formed. Cap table exists. Operator has authority.
rows.col_7: Implementation TUP created in File 2. Task extraction from locked content.

rows.col_4: All tasks complete OR kill triggered
rows.col_5: Execution log filed. Issues documented.
Template updates proposed. Lessons filed in knowledge base.
Implementation reveals imagination gap. Written justification required.
rows.col_7: Lock broken. New version created. Re-grade required. All amendments logged.

rows.col_5: Written justification. Pattern of overrides = system problem.
rows.col_7: State forced. Reason recorded. Trustee notified if post-funding.

rows.TUP STATE MACHINE — FORMAL PROTOCOL SPEC: INVARIANTS (conditions that must ALWAYS be true)
No TUP can enter PRODUCTION (S2) until M0 is in LOCKED (S5) or DRAFT (S1) with thesis committed.
No TUP can enter LOCKED (S5) without a grade ≥ B from an authorized Expert Reviewer.
No grade can be recorded on a V-tab except by a role with GRADE permission for that TUP's cluster.
No state transition occurs without the required permissions being held by the actor.
All overrides are logged with justification and are auditable by Trustee.
A TUP in LOCKED (S5) cannot have its content tabs modified except via formal amendment (TAMEND).
Equity vesting is triggered by T45 (EXPERT_REVIEW→LOCKED) and ONLY by T45. No other transition vests equity.
Claude produces ≈80% of content. PM refines ≈20%. This is explicit, not hidden. Workload specs reflect this ratio.
The Trustee has READ access to all states, transitions, and logs. Trustee permission applies to this entire state machine.
The protocol (this state machine) is the substrate. The MC show is a separate optional layer on top.
You could run this state machine without the show. The coordination would still work. Nobody would be watching.
The show makes the protocol observable. It is the legibility mechanism. But it is not the protocol itself.
Protocol coordinates. Show narrates. Same system, two layers. The show is optional. The protocol is not.
All transitions in this state machine are now TWO-KEY. See Compliance Protocol tab for counter-signer requirements.
Key 1 = Initiator (listed in "Required Permissions" column above). Key 2 = Counter-signer (Conductor or Librarian, depending on transition).
Additional guard condition on T45: IF grade_distribution = 100%_B_or_above for entire cluster THEN automatic_secondary_review triggered before lock.
See Grade Inflation Defense tab for full structural mechanisms.
